creator: bohnal@rpi.edu
text:
I wrote a large object-oriented application framework in php, using IIS and 
MSSQL. works like a charm. wanted to port to apache2. installed apache2 on a 
testing server. set up php and my system. output from all pages using my system 
(each page for which requires the use of many, many php include files, xml 
parsing, modules within php, etc) terminates after 1 - 2k is sent. error log 
says stuff like this:

[Wed May 14 18:09:40 2003] [notice] Parent: Created child process 1304
[Wed May 14 18:09:50 2003] [notice] Child 1304: Child process is running
[Wed May 14 18:09:51 2003] [notice] Child 1304: Acquired the start mutex.
[Wed May 14 18:09:51 2003] [notice] Child 1304: Starting 250 worker threads.
[Wed May 14 18:10:28 2003] [notice] Parent: child process exited with status 
3221225477 -- Restarting.
[Wed May 14 18:10:30 2003] [notice] Parent: Created child process 3040
[Wed May 14 18:10:32 2003] [notice] Child 3040: Child process is running
[Wed May 14 18:10:32 2003] [notice] Child 3040: Acquired the start mutex.
[Wed May 14 18:10:33 2003] [notice] Child 3040: Starting 250 worker threads.
[Wed May 14 18:10:54 2003] [notice] Parent: child process exited with status 
3221225477 -- Restarting.
[Wed May 14 18:10:56 2003] [notice] Parent: Created child process 4004
[Wed May 14 18:10:58 2003] [notice] Child 4004: Child process is running
[Wed May 14 18:10:58 2003] [notice] Child 4004: Acquired the start mutex.
[Wed May 14 18:10:58 2003] [notice] Child 4004: Starting 250 worker threads.
[Wed May 14 18:11:29 2003] [notice] Parent: child process exited with status 
3221225477 -- Restarting.

... installed IIS on the same box as a sanity check. worked fine with all 
pages. manually tested many critical components of php object system (debugger, 
database abstraction, that kind of thing) and they work. it's the synthesys 
that kills it. 

thankyou.

-fish

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
Sorry, but there is no way that we can debug something like this.  We have
absolutely no information about what is going on.

I'd start by trying to narrow down where the problem is.  You will probably
find it is php related, rather than a problem in the core server.
